io.orchestrate.client

Class OrchestrateClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.orchestrate.client.OrchestrateClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client

    public class OrchestrateClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements Client
    The client used to read and write data to the Orchestrate service.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrchestrateClient

        public OrchestrateClient(java.lang.String apiKey)
        Create a new client with the specified apiKey and default JacksonMapper.

        Equivalent to: 

         Client client = OrchestrateClient.builder("your api key").build();
        Parameters:
        apiKey - An API key for the Orchestrate.io service.

      • OrchestrateClient

        public OrchestrateClient(java.lang.String apiKey,
                 com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper objectMapper)
        Create a new client with the specified apiKey and objectMapper.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - An API key for the Orchestrate.io service.
        objectMapper - The Jackson JSON mapper to marshall data with.

      • OrchestrateClient

        Create a new client with the specified apiKey and mapper.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - An API key for the Orchestrate.io service.
        mapper - The mapper to marshall data with.

      • postValue

        public OrchestrateRequest<KvMetadata> postValue(java.lang.String collection,
                                       java.lang.Object value)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Store an object by value in the collection specified to the Orchestrate service which will auto-generate a key for it.

        Usage:

         DomainObject obj = new DomainObject();
 KvMetadata kvMetadata =
         client.postValue("someCollection", obj).get();
        Specified by:
        postValue in interface Client
        Parameters:
        collection - The name of the collection.
        value - The object to store.
        Returns:
        The prepared put request.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the request failed.
